Class ViewManager

java.lang.Object
main.ViewManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
ViewList
public class ViewManager extends Object implements ViewList
Manages the set of open AbstractViews in TablrApp

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewManager

      public ViewManager()

    • ViewManager

      public ViewManager(TablrManager tablrManager)

  • Method Details

    • addListener

      public void addListener(paintListener paintListener)
      Registers a paintListener to be notified of change in UI Context and the need to re invoke paint()
      Parameters:
      paintListener - the paintListener instance to be registered

    • openView

      public void openView(AbstractView view)
      Opens a new view and adds it to the list of managed MetaViews. Positions the new view at an offset relative to the currently active view. Notifies the paint listener of the update to ensure the UI is refreshed.
      Specified by:
      openView in interface ViewList
      Parameters:
      view - The AbstractView instance to be added to the list of views managed by this class.

    • closeView

      public void closeView(AbstractView view)
      Closes the specified view and removes it from the list of managed views. Also invokes handleDeadView(view) on each view. Notifies the paint listener of the update to ensure the UI is refreshed.
      Specified by:
      closeView in interface ViewList
      Parameters:
      view - The AbstractView instance to be closed and removed.

    • substituteView

      public void substituteView(AbstractView oldView, AbstractView newView)
      Substitutes an existing view with a new view in the list of managed views. Notifies the paint listener to refresh the UI.
      Specified by:
      substituteView in interface ViewList
      Parameters:
      oldView - The existing AbstractView instance to be replaced.
      newView - The new AbstractView instance to replace the old view.

    • moveViewLocation

      public void moveViewLocation(AbstractView view, int x, int y)
      Updates the location of the specified view by modifying its x and y coordinates based on the provided offset values. The paint listener is notified to refresh the UI to reflect the location change.
      Specified by:
      moveViewLocation in interface ViewList
      Parameters:
      view - The AbstractView instance whose location is to be updated.
      x - The horizontal offset by which to move the view's location.
      y - The vertical offset by which to move the view's location.

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Retrieves the title of the view.
      Returns:
      the title of the view as a String. The default title is "Tablr".

    • handleDoubleClick

      public void handleDoubleClick(int x, int y)
      Handles the double-click event based on the specified x and y coordinates. Activates the view located at the specified coordinates, performs a double-click action within the active view, and refreshes the UI.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate where the double-click occurred.
      y - The y-coordinate where the double-click occurred.

    • handleSingleClick

      public void handleSingleClick(int x, int y)
      Handles a single-click event at the specified coordinates. If there is an active view, the method activates the corresponding view at the given coordinates, translates the coordinates relative to the active view, and triggers a single-click action on that view. The UI is then refreshed by notifying the paint listener that the contents have changed.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate where the single-click occurred.
      y - The y-coordinate where the single-click occurred.

    • handleMouseDrag

      public void handleMouseDrag(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Handles a mouse drag event by identifying the active view and triggering the corresponding mouse drag handling within that view. The method uses the starting and ending coordinates of the drag to perform the operation. It ensures that the UI is updated after handling the drag.
      Parameters:
      startX - The x-coordinate where the drag operation starts.
      startY - The y-coordinate where the drag operation starts.
      endX - The x-coordinate where the drag operation ends.
      endY - The y-coordinate where the drag operation ends.

    • handleEscape

      public void handleEscape()
      invokes handleEscape() on the activeView.

      Invokes the paintListener

    • handleCtrlEnter

      public void handleCtrlEnter()
      invokes handleCtrlEnter() on the activeView.

      Invokes the paintListener

    • handleEnter

      public void handleEnter()
      invokes handleEnter() on the activeView.

      Invokes the paintListener

    • handleBackSpace

      public void handleBackSpace()
      invokes handleBackSpace() on the activeView.

      Invokes the paintListener

    • handleDelete

      public void handleDelete()
      invokes handleDelete() on the activeView.

      Invokes the paintListener

    • handleCharTyped

      public void handleCharTyped(char keyChar)
      invokes handleCharTyped() on the activeView.

      Invokes the paintListener

    • paint

      public void paint(Graphics g)
      invokes paint(g') on each view in order of last used, where g' is created from g with bounds corresponding to the dimensions of each view.
      Parameters:
      g - The Graphics object used for drawing the views.
